授業目的: This course focuses on the more recent development of the European Union (since 2004). Topics include EU enlargement, EU labour mobility, labour shortage & labour mismatch and labour market policies and BREXIT, among others.
到達目標:
This course aims at providing a better understanding of the current economic situation of the EU. The aim is that students understand the various connections between different events, as well as between economics, politics and society in Europe.

Students will improve the following skills: discussion skills, critical thinking, analytical skills, presentation skills and academic writing skills.
授業方法:
The course will be conducted as a seminar, and active student participation is expected.
Students permitted by KGU to participate online can participate via zoom.

第2回: The EU from its beginnings to now
第3回: The EU from its beginnings to now
第8回: Refugees in the EU, and its social and economic impact
